message.content:
<<<api>>>: AttributeSet.getAttributeValue
<<<code>>>: public MyTextView(Context context, AttributeSet attrs) {
                super(context, attrs);
                init(attrs);
            }

            private void init(AttributeSet attrs) {
                TypedArray a = getContext().obtainStyledAttributes(attrs, R.styleable.MyTextView);
                String fontName = a.getString(R.styleable.MyTextView_fontname);
                a.recycle();

                if (fontName != null) {
                    Typeface tf = Typeface.createFromAsset(getContext().getAssets(), "fonts/" + fontName);
                    setTypeface(tf);
                }
            }
<<<explanation>>>: In the constructor that takes an AttributeSet parameter, obtain the TypedArray using getContext().obtainStyledAttributes(attrs, R.styleable.MyTextView). Then, use the TypedArray to retrieve the value of the custom attribute "fontname" using getString(R.styleable.MyTextView_fontname). Finally, recycle the TypedArray to prevent memory leaks.
